title: Public reprimand recommended for judge accused of helping immigrant escape ICE
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Judge Shelley Joseph faces public reprimand for creating 'appearance of impropriety' related to 2018 ICE incident.
Hearing officer found no evidence Joseph authorized an immigrant's evasion from ICE but noted inappropriate court conduct.
Joseph previously faced obstruction charges but was cleared; federal charges were dropped in 2022 after state referral.

title: Alex Cora still high on Red Sox’ future a month after being eliminated by Yankees
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Red Sox manager Alex Cora remains optimistic about the team's future after losing to the Yankees in the Wild Card Series.
Boston's offseason begins with Trevor Story opting in and Alex Bregman opting out, creating uncertainty in the roster.
Cora highlights improvements and valuable postseason experience, despite challenges like injuries and the Rafael Devers trade.

title: Giant blade breaks off Mass. wind turbine
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: A 75-100 foot blade detached from a 300-foot wind turbine in Plymouth, Massachusetts, landing in a cranberry bog.
No injuries were reported, and the turbine automatically shut down in 'fail-safe mode' after the blade detached.
Officials are investigating the incident, with MassDEP and Inspectional Services ensuring the area is cleaned safely.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'The Fantastic Four: First Steps' is a new Marvel film streaming on Disney+, featuring Reed Richards and other superheroes.
'Frankenstein' by Guillermo del Toro, a reimagined Mary Shelley adaptation, is now available to stream on Netflix.
'Materialists,' a romcom starring Dakota Johnson and Pedro Pascal, is streaming on HBO Max.

title: Stefon Diggs reveals what he’s trying to improve about himself after 11 years in the NFL
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Stefon Diggs, Patriots wide receiver, aims to improve his attitude, describing a tendency to strive for perfection.
Diggs leads New England in receiving yards, receptions, and first down catches, contributing to the team's six-game win streak.
Offensive coaches Josh McDaniels and Todd Downing create a supportive environment, enhancing player performance on the Patriots.

title: Commuter train plows through car on tracks in Acton
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: An MBTA train hit an empty car on Central Street crossing in Acton; no injuries reported.
The driver exited the car before the incident, which happened at 5:30 p.m. on the Fitchburg line.
The crossing's gates functioned properly; the driver bypassed them, leading to train delays on November 6, 2025.

title: What to know about possible Red Sox free agent target Munetaka Murakami after posting
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Japanese star Munetaka Murakami, known for his power hitting, has been posted by Tokyo Yakult Swallows for MLB free agency.
Murakami, a two-time Central League MVP, hit a record 56 home runs in 2022, drawing interest from multiple MLB teams.
The Red Sox, along with other MLB teams, are potential suitors for Murakami, who will have 45 days to sign.

title: Airlines are waiving fees, offering refunds due to reduced flight schedules
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: FAA reduced flights by 10% at 40 airports, including Logan, due to the government shutdown.
Airlines like JetBlue, Southwest, and United are waiving change fees and offering refunds for affected travelers.
Delta, American, and Spirit provide rebooking options and full refunds for canceled flights booked by Nov. 5.

title: After Cape Cod crash, readers say Mass. should tighten e-bike regulations
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: A crash on Cape Cod involving an e-bike has sparked calls for stricter regulation of electric bicycles in Massachusetts.
In a reader survey, 78% supported tougher e-bike rules, citing safety concerns, while 20% opposed, arguing it was unnecessary.
Current Massachusetts law classifies e-bikes into two types with speeds up to 20 mph, but lacks regulation for faster models.

title: Watch: Dog rescued from Ted Williams Tunnel
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Massachusetts State Police rescued a dog that wandered into the Ted Williams Tunnel on Thursday morning.
Surveillance video showed the dog trotting towards traffic before a trooper halted vehicles for the rescue.
The dog, spotted near East Boston, was safely captured after initially evading capture and boarding a police cruiser.
